jlyrics
Class LyricsClassProfiler

java.lang.Object
  jlyrics.LyricsClassProfiler

public class LyricsClassProfiler
extends java.lang.Object

A library of static methods that can be used to build profiles about the relative frequencies of words in different categorization classes.

Constructor Summary

Method Detail

buildWordFrequencyProfile

public static java.lang.String buildWordFrequencyProfile(java.lang.String lyrics_directory_path)
                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
Parses all .txt files in the given directory and returns a report containing, among other things, a list of all words found in the text files sorted by their relative frequencies.

Parameters:
lyrics_directory_path - The directory to search for .txt files.
Returns:
A report listing the the directory searched, the total number of .txt files found, the number of songs with lyrics, the number of songs without lyrics, the total number or words, the total number of unique words, and a list of each unique word followed by a tab and how many times the word occurs, followed by another tab and what percentage of the total number of words that this represents. This list is sorted from the most common word to the least common word.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An informative exception is thrown if a prolem occurs.

buildWordFrequencyProfile

public static java.lang.String[] buildWordFrequencyProfile(java.lang.String lyrics_directory_path,
                                                           java.lang.String unique_classes_path,
                                                           java.lang.String classes_path,
                                                           java.lang.String identifiers_path)
                                                    throws java.lang.Exception
Parses all .txt files in the given directory and returns a report for each candidate class in the provided unique_classes_path file. Each report includes, among other information, sorted word frequencies across all files in the directory with identifiers matching those referred to in the identifiers_path file and with matching entries in the classes_path file that match the given unique classs.

Parameters:
lyrics_directory_path - The directory to search for .txt files.
unique_classes_path - A path of a .txt file containing a unique class name on each line. A report is generated for each class listed in this file, where each report only contains results from songs associated with the given class.
classes_path - The path of a .txt file containing the name of a class on each line. Each line should specify the class of the instance referred to on the matching line on the indentifiers_path file.
identifiers_path - The path of a .txt file containing an instance identifier on each line. Each instance should have a class corresponding to that listed on the corresponding line of the classes_path file.
Returns:
A report for each unique class listing, along with additional miscellaneous data, a list of each unique word followed by a tab and how many times the word occurs, followed by another tab and what percentage of the total number of words that this represents. This list is sorted from the most common word to the least common word.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An informative exception is thrown if a problem occurs.

writeReport

public static void writeReport(java.lang.String save_path,
                               java.lang.String report)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
Saves the given string to the given path.

Parameters:
save_path - The path to save to.
report - The information to save.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Throws an exception if a problem occurs.

calculateCounts

public static java.lang.StringBuffer calculateCounts(SongLyrics[] lyrics)
                                              throws java.lang.Exception
Prepares a report of how often each word appears in the given collection of SongLyrics objects. Note that all words are converted to lowercase to maintain case independence.

Parameters:
lyrics - The texts to search through. At least one of these must contain lyrics.
Returns:
A report listing the the number of songs with lyrics, the number of songs without lyrics, the total number or words, the total number of unique words, and a list of each unique word followed by a tab and how many times the word occurs, followed by another tab and what percentage of the total number of words that this represents. This list is sorted from the most common word to the least common word.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An informative exception if none of the provided SongLyrics contains any text.
